Params[3]: —15 minutes later.
...Aargh.
It takes Noan all his strength to move his heavily-wounded body and grabs onto the fence of the dock.
When he woke up in the darkness, he found himself surrounded by Corrupted. Without a way out, he resorted to jumping off the top of the lighthouse into the sea.
...This would have been the third time I fell and almost died if I hadn't become a Construct.
He sits on the road and catches his breath for a few seconds before standing up with his two swords and shaking off the water in his hair.
No, I can't rest yet...
Even though the infection and his injuries have pushed his frame to its limit, Noan still forces himself to shake it off and starts running.
...Lithos is still out there! He's going to hurt more people...!
Meanwhile—
Paper Crane transforms back into Lithos' chair. Around him are dozens of Constructs, all immobilized.
You're the only one left, Gray Raven Commandant.
The truth is I don't want to kill you. You're different from Ravenge. You're not... repulsive.
I'm happy to bring you back if you want and turn you into a Construct as well. I can try to make you one of us. Our companion.
Why?
Lithos slowly approaches you while paying attention to his surroundings. He does not seem hurried to take down his last target.

Params[2]: My actual companions need to connect to my Mind Beacon.
But I'd rather have Asimov do it.
Not to mention that my actual companions need to connect to my Mind Beacon.

Params[3]: Your actual companions...
Can't I be one?

Params[2]: I'm happy to consider it if you're willing to give up your villainous ways.

Params[3]: Haha... I've tried that already...
I also want to find a way to coexist with humans, but I've failed to achieve anything except hurting more people...

Params[2]: You want to coexist with humans?

Params[3]: I do. It must be hard for you to believe... but this is the one thing you can count on—
I love this world, and I love most people in it. I desperately want them to outlive this apocalypse, even if it means they have to live on in a different, slightly less intact form...
This does make me kind of an outlier among the Ascendants, you know?

You try to look for an exit again while he speaks. Unfortunately, you are on an open field right now. Without any covers, there is no way you can outrun a Construct, not to mention one with a strange mechanical chair.
It is not wise to confront an Ascendant alone. The best thing you can do right now is not to act rashly.
Ha... Does "Paper Crane" bother you?
Noticing your gaze, Lithos grins.
This is the "torture chair" I use to torment or kill the people who sit on it. Well-behaved children should stay away from her.
She was a mechanical wheelchair used to assist people with disability... but she has since transformed into this after my "fathers" remade her.
The people who raised me when I was young.
You have no idea what I'm talking about, do you? That's okay. Simply put... she's just an infected mechanoid now.
You don't have to understand her, and you don't have to know what happened between us. Just consider her as a Corrupted.
After all, it doesn't matter what I say. You humans will always treat it as the weapon of an Ascendant.
Do you regret coming here to investigate the deserters? These people wouldn't have been hurt if it weren't for you.
The captain of the Purifying Force... Bianca, isn't it? Mister must have killed her by now.
...Believe?
Are you going to keep resisting just because you believe things can change?
You're all the same, with so much confidence in your abilities... Can't you see how many of you are dying because of the Punishing Virus?
You might think the filtering is cruel... but if you keep fighting like this, what's the difference between the filtering and a victory that no one survives?
Ascendants are trying to save those with our gifts... Without us, even they are going to perish.

Params[2]: Without you, humanity would have won a long time ago.
We would have saved more people as well.

Params[3]: ...You can't save anybody.
You can't control the Punishing Virus. Even the air is toxic to you now.
The only way to survive this world is to pass the filtering.
The Punishing Virus around Lithos slowly forms into spikes that point at you.
Humanity's courage and hope... are nothing but illusions. It's the flame that kills the moth.
Before I crush that hope, Gray Raven Commandant, allow me to keep you with me. I will make sure to weave you a beautiful dream, even if you end up as fragments inside the Red Tide.
He raises his hand, and the spikes around him shoot toward you like a rainstorm.
Right as you are about to meet your end—thunder crackles, and lightning strikes from the sky!
A heavily damaged frame stands between you and the barrage of attacks, forming an unbreakable shield.
You're wrong, Lithos.
Hope is not an illusion. It's what came out of our countless sacrifices and sufferings!
Is this your choice and your answer?
Yes. It doesn't matter how many times you ask. I'll never agree with you and the filtering.
I don't want to stay in a chasm of exiles and cages; I don't want to see their joyless smiles; I don't want to pity your crocodile tears!
I will not give up on my dream...!
You can't save anyone without the power of an Ascendant. They will all die, just like your old comrades and companions did.
I know. But there are things I can do even as an ordinary person.
Babylonia won't accept someone who has a connection with the Ascendants. They won't stop seeing you as a threat.
I know. Better be treated as a threat than keep making the same mistake.
That's not the Eden you're looking for. They will exploit you and your desire to be a "hero" before discarding you or even accusing you of worse crimes you haven't committed.
I know. Been there, done that. I don't regret my choices.
Bella worriedly asked him three questions a few days before the battle on the train back then. Confused and stressed, all Noan could answer was "no idea."
But now, he knows he is not turning back, even if the path ahead is a grave laden with thorns!
My dream, that future we wanted, is right there beyond the seemingly infinite darkness.
Hope will triumph and fulfill its dream!
Noan leaps into the air with his blades, striking at the frail-looking body without hesitations.
The metal arms clash with the dual blades, sending sparks flying everywhere, even igniting the grass and leaves around them.
Flipping backward using the force from Lithos' counterattack, Noan strikes, aiming for his neck. Lithos has no intention to dodge, only catching Noan's sword with his bare hands.
The sharpened edge pierces Lithos' palms, and red vital fluid gushes out.
...You have made yourself clear. If you want to go, then go.
I still think you will return one day... You'll find me and ask for the power and freedom to trek through this apocalypse.
Holding Noan's sword in his hand, Lithos points it at his heart.
You can kill me. That's okay...
I'll die soon even if you don't do anything.
So... don't forget to introduce yourself again the next time you see me... I'm afraid I won't remember you.
Lithos lets go, and the blade goes through him.
Tear me apart if you want. I might still feel pain... but there's no reason to cherish a life that keeps getting reborn, is there?
...Lithos!
Bring him back, Paper Crane.
You hear a man's voice coming from the dark. Paper Crane immediately spreads its mechanical limbs and envelops Lithos before retreating.
Who is that?!
Noan dashes toward Paper Crane, but an invisible forcefield hits him squarely in the face.
...Ouch!
Y-yeah. Just had an old wound reopened on my head...
Gray Raven Commandant. I'm glad to see you here alive and well.
I'm afraid those who split up with you did not fare as well.
Don't worry. I haven't completely destroyed the "seeds" with potential.
Our experiment and game have come to an end. I'll see you next time, except... it might be sooner than you expected.
Right as they disappear behind the dark forest, you hear footsteps approaching hurriedly from behind. You turn to find Lucia arriving with reinforcement.
Commandant! I'm sorry I didn't make it in time!

Params[2]: You're right on time. That agent wouldn't have left otherwise.
But most of the people who followed me were heavily injured...

Params[3]: ...I can't believe that agent was here.

Params[2]: What's the situation on your side?

Params[3]: The injured members of the Purifying Force are back on Babylonia with our help.
Our transport crafts are arriving soon. Let's head back!

Params[2]: Alright. We'll move those unconscious to the boarding area first.

Params[3]: Cough... I'm sorry, but I don't think I can help.
Are you okay?
Damages and infections are both at my threshold, so...
He is still trembling even when he uses his swords to support himself.
Didn't realize it until the adrenaline passed... but I'm feeling...
A little...
He smiles apologetically before he collapses to the ground.
You work together to bring the wounded into the quarantine chamber before setting off on your journey back to Babylonia on the transport craft.
Our mission regarding the deserters isn't complete, Commandant.
Sitting by the cabin window, Lucia reviews the mission data solemnly.
We caught a lot of them, but we failed to progress on the Ascendant front.
Some Purifying Force members believed that the rescue request from Medical Center 09 was a diversion from the deserters and Ascendants.
They wanted to separate us from the Purifying Force.

Params[2]: Those people would have died if we didn't rescue them.
There are people we can't save wherever we go.
What we did saved the most people we could.

Params[3]: You're right, Commandant.
Looking at the young man inside the quarantine chamber, Lucia turns and looks at you pensively.
Is he one of the Constructs we save this time? He looks familiar... but I can't remember where I've seen him.

Params[2]: But I don't think he's who we think he is. That person...

Params[3]: Yeah, that person sacrificed himself.
She's in critical condition. She took a big hit trying to protect the others.
Lucia frowns.
That agent has yet to reveal his true strength. He just prefers to be defensive.
You two remain silent for a while, with the familiar sound of the engine as your backdrop. Soon, you hear a quiet moan from the quarantine chamber.
He's awake, Commandant.
...I'm alright.

Params[2]: Your infection rate is very high right now.

Params[3]: I know.
He sounds exhausted.

Params[2]: Sleeping in this state might cause your M.I.N.D. to deviate.

Params[3]: Alright.
Yeah. I think I remember everything.

Params[2]: Can you tell me your name, then?

Params[3]: You ask him the same question you asked when you first encountered him.
...My name...
Noan has been calling himself "Shrek" ever since he was thrown off Asslam, concealing his real name.
He did that to avoid the unresolved conflicts from finding him and to stay away from the rumors and accusations that would not leave him alone.
There were times when he wanted to use his real name, but people already knew him as "Shrek" by then. There was no reason to correct them.

Params[2]: What's wrong? You still can't remember?

Params[3]: I can. I remember.
Unlike the dream and the mask "Shrek" represents, "Noan" comes with scars of the past and the memories of losing his loved ones.
It is a name of pain and trouble. It still draws ire in some places, the name of a traitor and a sinner.
Which is why it is a name that can remind him not to stray from the path his soul has chosen.
He is heading to the future now. He will face many forking paths and choices.
If he has to choose a name now to symbolize his determination, then his name must be—
Noan. My name is Noan.
Nice to meet you, Commandant.
10: 21 AM, Science Council. A few days after Noan arrived at Babylonia.
There are indeed some anomalies in his frame.
But he wasn't controlling them, nor was he losing control. The Ascendant established a unique connection with him using the Punishing Virus.
I believe the Ascendant left behind some special connection technology in his frame or his M.I.N.D. when the Ascendant turned him into a Construct.
It's a fascinating design. It will certainly expand the possibilities for future Construct development.
So you're saying that he isn't an Ascendant or a Transcendant?
That's right. If I have to guess, the anomalies and his power only appeared because he was connected to and controlled by the Ascendant. He's just a normal Construct if he stays away from them.
Quite fitting for the Ascendant they called "Swindler" back in the day. He was lying when he said the kid would "lose control if he leaves the Ascendants."
I can't be sure if his frame or his M.I.N.D. have been affected by other factors because of that. Right now, I can't guarantee that he won't lose control again.
It's probably safer to keep him in the lab for now.
I don't recommend it. He has been nothing but corroborative. Locking him up any longer seems unnecessarily inhumane.
Are you sure?
He hasn't asked to change his frame, and every test and inspection was conducted as is.
High-pressure tests often damage his parts, and the inspections require removing some components. Those aren't a walk in the park.
He hasn't complained about anything. He would have shown it by now if he was incompliant.
Do you have a way to prevent him from losing control?
I do. I've left some "insurance policies" inside him after getting his permission.
When can we be sure that the threat is completely gone?
I'll need some time. The Ascendants are staying away from him currently. It will take longer to unravel its intricacies without a way to observe and collect samples.
We'll get a sample if he comes into contact with an Ascendant again, won't we?
Hmph. That sounds like something Kurono and their researchers would do. They won't let this go if they find out about him.
He'll most likely die or defect if we do that. Before we solve this issue or replace his frame, I suggest keeping him away from missions that might involve the Ascendants.
I guess I made the right choice assigning him to Dark Aries.
Dark Aries has been reinstated?
Yes. Everyone on that team had some issues, so it was time to change things up.
Who's the captain?
Palma.
Why her?
She's the only one left.
Noan is more than qualified, but he can't be trusted yet. We couldn't assign him that role.
Lillian is a little timid. She's no leader, and her records aren't exactly "spotless."
We questioned her, and although she said she wasn't aware when she brought Noan to Medical Center 09, we can't be completely sure she isn't responsible.
But we are shorthanded right now, so we can't afford a heavy penalty. We'll let her get used to the new squad first.
All that was left, then, was Palma the "butcher."
All three of them have something to do with Kurono, especially Lillian and Palma. Noan just got here, but Kurono won't give up on the secrets in his frame that easily.
It'll be challenging for Simon to lead a "problem squad" like this.
He isn't fit to participate in missions on the surface physically, to begin with. I'm giving him time to rest and let him and his team learn more about each other.
This is already the third iteration of Dark Aries. We shouldn't overburden Simon.
It was his request. He said he would no longer... watch on as his teammate defected the way he did.
...So he accepted the surveillance mission on Noan?
Not just Noan; the other two are also potential risks. Given how the fight on the surface is escalating, there is no one else more suited for this job.
Don't we have enough people watching him already?
We shouldn't relax as long as we can't stop people from deserting. Noan is just one of the surveillance targets.
Speaking of which.
Noan mentioned the deserters during an inspection.
I don't think the true purpose of that agent is tempting our people to defect.
I briefly heard him mentioning that it could be a diversion.
Given that Lithos was the only person responsible for this incident... I felt like the agent had a different agenda.
I guess we need to send more people to the surface to investigate.
Did he say anything new about that Ascendant "Lithos"?
The same things he said when we questioned him, but...
Asimov remembers the first day Noan arrived at the Science Council for the inspection.
Lithos?!
Aargh!
What's wrong?
I d-don't know... Sob... He suddenly appeared behind me... Sob... Did I do something wrong?
...You're...
Noan pauses for two seconds, staring at the girl's purple hair and her eyes before coming to his senses.
Ugh... My apologies. I confused you with someone else... You are...?
Uh... I'm Rosa... I'm Mr. Asimov's assistant.
I'm sorry, Rosa.
That's okay. It's okay.
He falls silent again, staring at her.
How come...
What is it?
Nothing. It was a baseless misunderstanding.
Rosa has enough problems as it is. Asimov decides not to mention something this trivial.
How is Lee's specialized frame?
We can complete the adaptation and the construction at any time.
But it will just be another "Empyrea" in its current state. We still haven't made any significant improvements.
We're investigating the unique connection technology on Noan. Hopefully, it will bring some new ideas to the development of the specialized omega frame.
Extend our order from a few days ago and keep Lee in Babylonia. He is one of our few remaining hopes. We can't let anything happen to him.
Noan broke free from an Ascendant's control by himself, which means he is also capable of adapting to a specialized frame.
His connection to the Ascendants means there are still many uncertainties about him. It's safer to place our bets on Lee before we are sure where Noan stands.
It seems that... Gray Raven will only consist of Lucia and the commandant for the time being.
Although Liv has woken up...
Alright, that's it for today's treatment.
Thank you, Professor. You too, Commandant... Thank you for coming back to Babylonia so frequently to assist with the process.

Params[2]: As long as I can help.

Params[3]: You never stop helping, Commandant.
Right... o-okay...
How have you been? Any issues during battles?
It's a medical miracle that you woke up—or so I thought.
I only recently discovered that the monitoring and medical devices in your room were modified before reverting to their original state. The timing matches the time you awoke.
I don't know who did it, and I don't know how it was done. All records at that time have been overwritten.
Anyway, I'm going to look into it. I won't let some kind stranger remain anonymous! And I'm going to drag whoever that is to the hospital to help!
The professor laughs as she waves, turning away and leaving.
The migraines have gotten much better with the professor and your help.
Lucia told me that you saved a person while you were on the surface, and he's serving in Dark Aries now?
It's great to have a new person with us.
You too, Commandant. You should rely more on others instead of carrying everything on your shoulders.
Liv smiles and nods.
I'm already relying on you, Commandant, and so many others. And I will keep doing so.
You see a familiar figure wandering outside the WGAA after you leave the Star of Life.
Good afternoon, Commandant.

Params[2]: What are you doing here by yourself?

Params[3]: Commandant Simon asked me to requisition some supplies, and I'm still learning my way around here.
What about you? Why are you here alone?

Params[2]: I'm heading back to the Gray Raven lounge.

Params[3]: Some spare weapons and a coating.
Captain Palma said I looked like I was, and I quote, "fished out from a pile of Corrupted." So she told me to apply for a fresh coating from the WGAA.
I haven't seen how they swap a coating, so I would love the chance to experience it myself.
But I haven't found out where the requisitioning office is...
Is that okay?
Thank you, then.
He walks toward you with a smile.

Params[2]: How are you, by the way?

Params[3]: I'm good. Commandant Simon is a very gentle person.
Everyone else is... polite.
Looking at the intricate architecture of Babylonia, he reveals a hint of confusion in his eyes.
Lee happens to be walking past as he returns from Maintenance, and he sees a familiar figure heading further inside the WGAA.
How is the commandant free to hang around this place?
Confused, Lee takes another look, and he sees the other familiar figure.
He immediately dismisses the thought.
(...What was I thinking? There was no way he could survive. That must be another Construct who happens to look similar.)
But then—
That young Construct has chosen a new coating.
But... that's just the preview for the dye effect. Are you sure about that?
What's wrong with it?
It's ugly!
You too?! Is that what a Chief prefers?
Arrgh...! You...
The WGAA staff member covers his eyes in anguish.
I'm just curious how it looks in rainbow colors. Relax, I won't wear it outside.
Seriously?
I'll take it off, regretful as it may be...
...Hey.
Lee?
You're still alive?
I am. It's been a while.
Don't you recognize him? He's Shrek.
Ah... I might have forgotten to mention that.
Take off that disco ball on your head and put on your test coating before you catch up!
...Anyway, that was what happened.
You even picked up that book! Fate, am I right?
I almost forgot about it then, and we didn't really have the time to talk about it when I remembered it.
And the Ascendants made you a Construct. Your luck...
That's not fair. If you hadn't jumped off with the Omega Weapon, you would have just died from your wounds inside the train. Don't even mention how you got away from the Ascendants.
Is that a compliment?
...You can think what you want.
I'm glad you survived.

Params[2]: By the way, why are you here, Lee?

Params[3]: I saw you guys hanging around outside.

Params[2]: I was showing the newbie around.

Params[3]: He has his own commandant, doesn't he?
What about the others?
...They're...
Noan smiles resignedly, swallowing the rest of his words.
Because of your connection with the Ascendants?
Has everyone heard about it already?

Params[2]: There have been a lot of new faces from the surface lately.
Managing and distributing information has been a mess.

Params[3]: I see...
The more anxious people are, the more they want to stay informed. Even if what they hear are plain lies.
That's alright. I have plenty of experience with something like that. Don't worry about me.
I still have to go see Asimov. You guys go ahead.

Params[2]: Don't you have something else to say?

Params[3]: Why aren't you working if you have so much free time?
He walks away.
I kind of feel like Lee was hoping you'd go to rest.
It was his gaze... or maybe his tone?
Of course you did. You're a Chief.

Params[2]: Did Simon teach you to say that?

Params[3]: Yeah. He always mentioned you or asked me how you did on the surface when we chatted.
He might not say it out loud, but I suppose that was how he showed he cared.
Noan smiles as he takes off the test coating on him.
I'll take this one.
Do you have no other requirements? Members from pending elite squads are allowed to request customizations on their coatings.
This is good. I'll take the one everyone uses.
ok~
Thanks.
Let's go, Commandant.
You really should rest now. Commandant Simon said you just returned from a mission, and you're already preparing for your next.
Let me walk you back to the Gray Raven lounge. I have to go back to the Dark Aries lounge as well.
Hmm? What is it?
Do you prefer "Shrek" more?
Sure. Shrek is my name too. Call me the way you like.
What were you asking me?
Do I regret coming to Babylonia?
I don't.
I've been interrogated, monitored, alienated... and asked to join those researches.
Did you think this would happen when you asked me to come to Babylonia with you?

Params[4]: I'm sorry. I was focusing on the Ascendant that day.

Params[3]: I thought about this too when I agreed to come.
It's alright. I thought about this when I agreed to come.
Lithos warned me too. You heard that.
I thought it through before I made the decision.

Params[2]: This is going to be hard.

Params[3]: Is anything easy?
People went through hardships even back in the peaceful days.
And you, "hero"?
Has your journey been easy?
Do you regret taking on this hardship, then?

Params[4]: My only regret is that I couldn't save more people.

Params[3]: Have you thought about running away and giving up because you couldn't stand the pain?
Me neither. But not giving up doesn't mean it doesn't hurt.
I might be a Construct, but I'm still human inside.
I know I feel pain because there are still people and things I care about and a future I want to see.
But you aren't running. Why?

Params[2]: Because there is nowhere to run.
Params[4]: Because there are still people and things I care about.

Params[3]: You can always run if you want to... Dying is a way to run away.
You haven't run away because there are still people and things you care about. That's what drives you forward.
Yeah... I also have people and things I care about and a future I want to see.
So... our answers are the same.
No matter how painful and difficult it gets, I won't regret it.
It's proof that I still care. I'd rather live on with this regret and pain than give up my dream for an easier path.
By the way, there's something I never had the chance to tell you.
Thank you for pulling me up at the last moment.

Params[2]: I just did what I should do.
Params[4]: Thank you for accepting my invitation.

Params[3]: He smiles, stopping before a forking road.
That is the way to Dark Aries' lounge.

Params[2]: I should head back as well.

Params[3]: I'll see you around, Commandant.
The two of you wave goodbye before heading your separate ways.
Despite realizing how ordinary he is and knowing how he will face many challenges with this ordinary body, his footsteps feel determined without a hint of doubt.

Params[1]: An ordinary life is like wild grass.
Wild grass strikes no deep roots, has no beautiful flowers and leaves, yet it imbibes dew, water and the blood and flesh of the dead, all trying to rob them of life.
As long as it lives, it is trampled upon and mown down, until it dies and decays.
But please do not loathe how ordinary it is or how it decays.
It is the price for a soul to burn.
Rejoice for their uncompromising souls. Laugh and sing for the snow they melt with their flame.
They would rather greet death than obey and perish in silence.
He<//SURVIVOR> is walking on a path paved with deaths<//FIREFLY>.
One day, he<//SURVIVOR> will also face his death, guided by the fireflies<//THEIR LOVE>.
This is the choice the wild grass made.
You will still see him smiling when it is his time to go.

Params[3]: Assets/Product/Texture/Atlas/CommonLogo/BgLogo1.png
